dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.
dependencies.name: py-cython

dependencies.description:
Multi-backend Keras. Keras 3 is a new multi-backend implementation of
the Keras API, with support for TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch.
dependencies.name: py-keras

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.
dependencies.name: py-scikit-learn

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.
dependencies.name: py-tensorflow

dependencies.description:
Python helpers to limit the number of threads used in the threadpool-
backed of common native libraries used for scientific computing and data
science (e.g. BLAS and OpenMP).
dependencies.name: py-threadpoolctl

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
Multi-class imbalance is a common problem occurring in real-world
supervised classifications tasks. While there has already been some
research on the specialized methods aiming to tackle that challenging
problem, most of them still lack coherent Python implementation that is
simple, intuitive and easy to use. multi-imbalance is a python package
tackling the problem of multi-class imbalanced datasets in machine
learnin
dependent_to.name: py-multi-imbalance

description:
imbalanced-learn is a python package offering a number of re-sampling
techniques commonly used in datasets showing strong between-class
imbalance. It is compatible with scikit-learn and is part of scikit-
learn-contrib projects.
name: py-imbalanced-learn

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
